thread.title: Fla. newlywed, 76, shoots wife in the butt over lack of sex life
thread.title_full: Fla. newlywed, 76, shoots wife in the butt over lack of sex life

author: MINYVONNE BURKE
title: Fla. newlywed, 76, shoots wife in the butt over lack of sex life
text:
Florida newlywed, 76, confesses to shooting wife in the butt because she wouldn't consummate marriage Fla. newlywed, 76, shoots wife in the butt over lack of sex life   12:13 PM 
Donald Royce's marriage is already getting off to a bumpy start. 
Seven months after saying "I do," the 76-year-old Florida resident was arrested after confessing to shooting his new bride in the butt after an argument over their sex life, or lack thereof. 
According to a Lee County Sheriff's Office, Royce and his 62-year-old wife were bickering because she refused to have sex with him. 
The couple's roommate said she heard the arguing followed by two gun shots, Four In Your Corner reported . When she went to see what happened, Royce pointed the gun at her but she was able to talk him into letting her call the ambulance for his wife. 
Delaware woman pleads guilty to poisoning husband with antifreeze 
When authorities arrived at the home, Royce immediately confessed telling police, "I shot her and the gun is in my room." When questioned at the police station, Royce said that he got married in August, but had yet to consummate the marriage. Florida newlywed, 76, shot his wife because she refused to sleep with him. (Lee County Sheriff’s Office) 
An arrest report said Royce became "violently angry" after his wife's refusal to sleep with him. 
He also told police that he didn't mean to shoot his wife and was aiming for their mattress. 
Royce's wife, who has not been identified, was taken to Lee Memorial Hospital with a gunshot wound to her butt and another to her hip. 
Man reveals wife said ‘I love you’ after he shot her by accident 
The new bride is already back home recuperating, and told Four In Your Corner that she dated Royce for six years before they tied the knot. 
She also called the entire situation a "nightmare," but said she hoped to spread the message that violence towards women is never OK. 
Royce was charged with aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and is still being held on $100,000 bond, NBC Miami reported . Join the Conversation:
